summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020, forwarding a letter from an anonymous individual to the SDNY/FBI. The writer claims knowledge about Ghislaine Maxwell's connections to Hollywood figures, alleges that Natalie Portman, Reese Witherspoon, and Bob Iger attempted to assist Maxwell in locating the writer, and offers to help the DOJ. The writer also requests a reinvestigation into the Walt Disney Company's dividend reinvestment program.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case, described as not being the 'true prize' with many others involved. The writer alleges Hollywood figures attempted to assist her.

persons.name: Natalie Portman
persons.context: Named by the writer as someone who, along with Reese Witherspoon, attempted to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in finding the writer.

persons.name: Reese Witherspoon
persons.context: Named by the writer as someone who, along with Natalie Portman, attempted to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in finding the writer.

persons.name: Bob Iger
persons.role: Former CEO of Walt Disney Company
persons.context: Alleged by the writer to have tried to assist Ghislaine Maxwell with 'greater zeal' than Portman or Witherspoon, including hiring a private investigator.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an investigation the writer previously worked on with reporters before turning attention to Epstein.

connections.description: Writer alleges Portman attempted to assist Maxwell in finding the writer.
Writer alleges Witherspoon attempted to assist Maxwell in finding the writer.
Writer alleges Iger tried to assist Maxwell with 'greater zeal,' including hiring a private investigator.

events.title: Anonymous Letter Sent
events.description: An anonymous individual sends a letter to the SDNY/FBI alleging Hollywood connections to Ghislaine Maxwell and offering assistance.

events.title: Original Letter Sent
events.description: The writer references an original letter they sent on this date, which is being forwarded.

keyFacts: An anonymous writer alleges that Hollywood figures Natalie Portman, Reese Witherspoon, and former Disney CEO Bob Iger attempted to assist Ghislaine Maxwell in locating the writer.
The writer claims Maxwell had 'ingratiated herself substantially' with Hollywood at large.
The writer offers to help the DOJ connect dots and provides a phone number (858-761-3770) for which they authorize subpoena of Verizon Wireless records.
The writer suggests calls may have originated from Disney conference rooms in Burbank, California.
The writer requests the FBI reopen an investigation into the Walt Disney Company's dividend reinvestment program, alleging theft of funds.
